content.raw:
To avoid leaks, it is better to provide C++ interfaces with a virtual destructor, to make sure that the destructor of the derived class will always be called. 
See Guideline 4 in http://www.gotw.ca/publications/mill18.htm : *"A base class destructor should be either public and virtual, or protected and nonvirtual"*.
